DESCRIPTION.LINE_1: Each evening of the event will include three main moments: Nama Chanting, a short discourse, and a Q&A session.
DESCRIPTION.LINE_2: Under Ma Devaki's guidance, we will practice together the repetition of the mantra 'Yogi Ramsuratkumar Jaya Guru Raya', a simple and profound form of prayer through which the mind becomes calm and the heart opens. Chanting does not require musical performance, but only sincere participation, an invitation to presence and inner connection with God.

CONTENT.P1: Mataji is here with us to share her experiences with the Great Yogi Yogi Ramsuratkumar.
CONTENT.P2: Her visit to Romania is part of an international tour that, over the past two years, has included meetings in the United States, Dubai, and this year in several European countries.
CONTENT.P3: She brings to life His teachings, which are very relevant to modern life and emphasizes the greatness of chanting His Name in a way that touches and transforms lives.

TRANSLATION.TITLE: Simultaneous Translation
TRANSLATION.DESCRIPTION: The 2 evenings of Satsang will be conducted in English, with simultaneous translation into Romanian. Additional information on this topic will be provided via email after registering for the event.

QUOTE.TEXT: Remembering God is Life Forgetting God is death
QUOTE.AUTHOR: - Bhagwan Yogi Ramsuratkumar -

CONTENT.P1: Ma Devaki was a Quantum Physics professor for 20 years at Sarada College in Salem, where she was appreciated for her involvement in education, and for over 20 years, she has been transmitting His teachings through satsang sessions, deep reflections, and mantra recitations, inspiring thousands of people worldwide.
CONTENT.P2: Ma Devaki Mataji is a founding member of Yogi Ramsuratkumar Ashram and Ma Devaki Veda Patashala School, Tiruvannamalai. Alongside her academic activity, Ma Devaki was deeply drawn to the spiritual path, and her quest led her to Tiruvannamalai, where she met Yogi Ramsuratkumar, a moment that deeply marked her life.
CONTENT.P3: Her mission is to spread the Master's spiritual teachings and guide seekers on the spiritual path through Nama and Guru Seva. Today, Ma Devaki is a source of inspiration for many, being a living example of pure love and devotion in the service of spirituality.

CONTENT.P1: Blessed are those who meet a Gnani during their lifetime. Even more blessed are those who recognize him for what he is and benefit from his divine association. Such a Brahma Gnani is Yogi Ramsuratkumar, in whom thousands of people have found solace, support, and peace in life.
CONTENT.P2: Born on December 1, 1918, Yogi Ramsuratkumar was a hidden saint who lived as a beggar on the streets of Tiruvannamalai, Tamil Nadu. In his quest for a Guru and Truth, he traveled through South India, where he met his three Gurus: Sri Aurobindo, Ramana Maharishi, and Papa Ramdas. The living spiritual Master - Papa Ramdas initiated him into the mantra 'Om Sri Ram Jai Ram Jai Jai Ram' and told him: 'Go and repeat day and night, all twenty-four hours.' Within seven days and seven nights, Ramsuratkumar made the great exodus from the Kingdom of man to the Kingdom of God. Ramsuratkumar became YOGI RAMSURATKUMAR, a savior of ignorant souls with a mission greater than his own liberation. Today, His Name, YOGI RAMSURATKUMAR, offers help, guidance, and protection to all who chant it and is a sanctuary of peace, love, and joy.
CONTENT.P3: Ma Devaki, whom Sri Yogiji called His eternal servant, personally served Him for seven years until His Mahasamadhi in 2001. Mataji has continued her service at His Ashram in Tiruvannamalai for the past twenty-three years.

CONTENT.P1: Yogi Ramsuratkumar Ashram in Tiruvannamalai, India, is a spiritual center dedicated to the teachings and mission of Yogi Ramsuratkumar, known as the 'Child of God'. The Ashram offers free various activities aimed at supporting the spiritual, educational, and social growth of the community.
CONTENT.P2: Yogi Ramsuratkumar Ashram is a living example of how spirituality can be integrated into daily life, offering support and light to those seeking inner peace and spiritual growth.

SCHEDULE.C1: The day begins early at 5:30 AM with the opening of the altar and the Arati ritual. Between 6:00-7:00 AM and 6:15-7:15 PM, Ma Devaki leads sessions of chanting the mantra 'Yogi Ramsuratkumar Jaya Guru Raya', which continues throughout the day. The daily schedule includes meditation, prayers, satsangs, and karma yoga activities, encouraging a life lived in devotion and selfless service.
SCHEDULE.C2: The Ashram hosts Ma Devaki Veda Patasala, an institution founded in 1999 to promote the study of Vedas, Agamas, Puranas, and other sacred scriptures. This school offers free traditional education in Sanskrit and Indian philosophy, aiming to preserve and revitalize Vedic culture. Additionally, Yogi Ramsuratkumar Vidyalaya, a primary school established in 2002, provides free education to children from the community, combining modern education with Vedic studies and extracurricular activities.
SCHEDULE.C3: The Ashram organizes monthly free medical camps, starting from 1999, serving hundreds of people in Tiruvannamalai. It also offers Annadhanam ‚Äì free meals ‚Äì daily at lunch and during festivals. During crisis periods, such as the COVID-19 pandemic, the ashram distributed food and essential supplies to those affected.
SCHEDULE.C4: The Ashram maintains a shelter for approximately 50 cows, considered sacred in Hindu tradition. The dairy products are distributed to school children and local orphanages, reflecting deep respect for life and nature.
SCHEDULE.C5: The community around the ashram is deeply involved in its activities, participating in rituals, volunteering, and supporting educational and social initiatives. The devotion and unity of this community reflect Yogi Ramsuratkumar's teachings about love, humility, and selfless service.
